section.p: Note that a goal might be constructed of sub-goals, which might each be associated with a single outcome. For example, a goal to loose 5 pounds per week over 6 weeks might spawn 6 child goals to loose 5 pounds in week 1, week 2, etc. Each child goal would be associated with one actual outcome (i.e., lost 4 pounds in week 1; lost 6 pounds in week 2, etc). Then the "parent" goal outcome could be the total (e.g., lost 28 pounds in 6 weeks).

ol.li: Contains exactly one [1..1] category with data type Code
Contains exactly one [1..1] dateEstablished with data type Point In Time
Contains exactly one [1..1] description with data type String
Contains exactly one [1..1] desiredOutcome with data type String
Contains exactly one [1..1] goalIntent with data type String
Contains exactly one [1..1] goalType with data type Code
Contains exactly one [1..1] id with data type Id

Contains exactly one [1..1] patientApprovalLevel with data type String
Provides an indication of the extent to which the patient is in agreement with the goal. Note that this is a prospective measurement.

Contains exactly one [1..1] patientAdherenceLevel with data type String
Provides an indication of the extent to which the patient adhered to the goal Note that this is a retrospective measurement.
Contains exactly one [1..1] priority with data type String
Contains exactly one [1..1] shortOrLongTerm with data type Code
Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
Contains exactly one [1..1] targetDate with data type Point In Time
Contains zero or more [0..*] reviewedBy, where its type is Reviewer
Contains zero or more [0..*] relatedGoal, where its type is Related Goal
Contains zero or more [0..*] actualOutcome, where its type is Actual Outcome
Contains zero or more [0..*] goalEvaluation, where its type is Goal Evaluation
Contains exactly one [1..1] author, where its type is Author
Contains exactly one [1..1] supporter, where its type is Supporter
